question_text: The total of a bill is £34.70. What is this amount rounded to the nearest whole pound?
A plank of wood measures 89.2 cm. What is its length rounded to the nearest 10 cm?
A calculation results in the number 128. What is this number rounded to the nearest 10?
A distance is calculated to be 45.4 metres. What is this distance to the nearest whole metre?
A shop sells 241 newspapers. What is this number rounded to the nearest 10?
The answer to a sum is 9.8. What is this rounded to the nearest whole number?
A weight is 556 grams. What is this weight rounded to the nearest 10 grams?
A liquid has a volume of 8.3 litres. What is the volume to the nearest whole litre?
A calculation gives the answer 677. What is this rounded to the nearest 10?
A temperature is 15.6 degrees. What is this to the nearest whole degree?
A school has 992 students. What is this number rounded to the nearest 10?
A length is measured as 20.5 cm. What is this length to the nearest whole cm?
The sum of two numbers is 489. What is the sum rounded to the nearest 10?
The result of a measurement is 0.9 metres. What is this to the nearest whole metre?
A crowd of 785 people attended a match. Round this number to the nearest 10.
A parcel weighs 12.1 kg. What is the weight to the nearest whole kilogram?
A calculation results in 304. What is this number rounded to the nearest 10?
A tree is 6.8 metres tall. What is its height to the nearest whole metre?
The answer to a division problem is 198. Round the answer to the nearest 10.
A capacity is 99.6 litres. Round this to the nearest whole litre.
A number is 501. What is this rounded to the nearest 10?
The area of a shape is 78.5 square cm. What is the area to the nearest whole square cm?
A price is £142. Round this to the nearest £10.
A calculation gives 0.4. What is this to the nearest whole number?
A farmer has 888 sheep. Round this to the nearest 10.
The average cost of a meal is £12.37. What is this rounded to one decimal place?
A population is 1,234. Round this number to the nearest 100.
A length is measured as 45.67 cm. What is this length to the nearest tenth of a cm?
A calculation gives an answer of 876. What is this rounded to the nearest hundred?
A car travels 54.82 miles. Round this distance to one decimal place.
A company's profit is £9,870. What is this profit rounded to the nearest 100 pounds?
A weight is 0.45 kg. What is this weight to one decimal place?
The attendance at a concert was 5,621. Round this to the nearest 100 people.
A volume is 19.95 litres. What is this rounded to one decimal place?
A calculation results in 499. Round this to the nearest 100.
A measurement is 7.08 metres. What is this to one decimal place?
A price is listed as £234. Round this to the nearest £100.
The answer to a problem is 89.91. What is this rounded to the nearest whole number?
A distance is 4,550 metres. What is this to the nearest 100 metres?
A chemical sample weighs 1.23 grams. What is its weight rounded to one decimal place?
A phone costs £789. What is its cost rounded to the nearest £100?
A timer shows 59.61 seconds. What is this time to the nearest whole second?
A farm has 2049 sheep. How many sheep are there to the nearest 100?
A capacity is 0.09 litres. What is this to one decimal place?
A number is 99. Round it to the nearest 100.
The area of a room is 25.48 square metres. What is the area to one decimal place?
A factory produced 8,050 cars. Round this to the nearest hundred.
A bill comes to £45.92. What is this to the nearest whole pound?
A calculation gives 12.02. Round this to one decimal place.
A population is 9,960. What is this to the nearest hundred?
A builder cuts three pieces of wood: 1.25m, 2.31m, and 0.85m. What is their total length, rounded to one decimal place?
A car costs £12,560. Round this cost to the nearest thousand pounds.
A liquid has a volume of 0.875 litres. What is its volume rounded to two decimal places?
The average of three numbers is 15.22. What is this average rounded to the nearest whole number?
The population of a town is 45,389. For a newspaper report, what is a sensible number to use, rounded to the nearest 1000?
A sprinter runs 100m in 9.58 seconds. What is this time rounded to the nearest tenth of a second?
A cake recipe needs 0.125 kg of sugar. To the nearest hundredth of a kg, how much is this?
A company's annual profit is £1,234,567. Round this to the nearest hundred thousand pounds.
What is the result of 10 divided by 3, rounded to two decimal places?
A farm has an area of 128.9 hectares. What is this area rounded to the nearest 10 hectares?
You have two parcels weighing 2.45 kg and 3.08 kg. What is their combined weight, rounded to the nearest whole kg?
A measurement is 0.078 metres. What is this rounded to the nearest hundredth of a metre?
An invoice total is £456.78. Round this amount to the nearest £10.
A race was won by 0.012 seconds. Round this to two decimal places.
A shop's takings are £12,055. Round this to the nearest £1000.
A liquid's temperature is 37.77 degrees Celsius. What is this to one decimal place?
A piece of wire is 15.6 cm long. If you cut it into 4 equal pieces, what is the length of one piece, rounded to one decimal place?
A builder needs 25 kg of sand. He has 12.4 kg and 13.2 kg. Does he have enough, and what is the total rounded to the nearest whole kg?
A value is 1.996. What is this rounded to two decimal places?
The distance to the moon is 384,400 km. What is this to the nearest 10,000 km?
A calculation is 5 divided by 8. What is the answer rounded to two decimal places?
You mix 0.75 L and 0.55 L of liquid. What is the total volume, rounded to the nearest whole litre?
The exact area of a circle is 78.539 cm². What is the area to one decimal place?
A budget is £850,000. Round this to the nearest hundred thousand.
A phone screen is 0.128 cm thick. Round this to the nearest hundredth of a cm.
A company makes a profit of £1,254,890. For a press release, they need to round this to an appropriate degree of accuracy. What would be a sensible rounded figure?
A scientist measures a sample as 0.0078 grams. For his report, he needs to round to three decimal places. What should he write?
The average of five test scores is 85.38. For a school report that only uses whole numbers, what score should be recorded?
A financial calculation results in £45.675. What is the most appropriate way to represent this as a monetary value?
The exact answer to a problem is 1/7. What is this as a decimal rounded to three decimal places?
A stadium capacity is 75,550. An article says the capacity is about 76,000. To what degree of accuracy has the number been rounded?
You calculate the cost per item is £0.562. If you sell 100 items, what would the total sales be, rounded to the nearest pound?
The distance between two cities is 345.5 miles. If you need to estimate fuel, would it be better to round to the nearest mile or nearest 10 miles? Why?
A calculation is 200 divided by 3. What is the answer rounded to the nearest whole number?
You have three planks of wood: 1.25m, 1.35m, 1.45m. What is their average length, rounded to one decimal place?
A company's sales are £8,750,123. For the annual report, this is rounded to £8.8 million. Is this an appropriate level of accuracy?
A very precise measurement is 10.12345 cm. Round this to a sensible accuracy for use in a school science experiment.
The result of a scientific calculation is 0.000567. Round this to four decimal places.
A survey shows 1,230 out of 2,000 people prefer Brand A. This is 61.5%. For a headline, what is the best way to state this?
The exact volume of a sphere is 523.598... cm³. Round this to the nearest whole number.
A budget for a project is £18,500. Which is a more appropriate rounded figure for a quick summary: £19,000 or £20,000?
What is 100 divided by 6, rounded to the nearest tenth?
A map has a scale where 1cm = 2.5km. A distance on the map is 3.5cm. The calculated real distance is 8.75km. Round this to a sensible whole number.
A bank pays 1.5% interest. On £1000, this is £15.00. On £125, this is £1.875. How should £1.875 be written as money?
The population of the world is estimated at 7,888,123,456. Round this to the nearest billion.
A car travels 10 miles in 15 minutes (0.25 hours). Its speed is 40 mph. Its speed is also 64.373... km/h. Round the speed in km/h to one decimal place.
The value of Pi is 3.14159... What is Pi rounded to two decimal places?
You need to share £10 equally among 3 people. How much does each person get, to an appropriate degree of accuracy?
A box contains 150 items and weighs 32.4 kg. What is the average weight per item, rounded to three decimal places?
A computer hard drive has 1000 gigabytes. You use 1/3 of it. How many gigabytes have you used, rounded to the nearest whole number?
What is 1/2 of 10?
A group of 9 children are playing. 1/3 of them are wearing hats. How many children are wearing hats?
What is a quarter of 16?
There are 10 pencils in a box. 1/5 of them are red. How many red pencils are there?
Find one-fourth of 12.
When counting in tenths from 0, what comes after 0.1?
When counting in tenths, what number comes before 1.0?
What is 1/3 of 15?
A farmer has 14 sheep. 1/2 of them are white. How many white sheep are there?
Count forwards in tenths: 0.5, 0.6, 0.7, __
What is 1/5 of 20?
A piece of ribbon is 16cm long. What is 1/4 of its length?
Count backwards in tenths: 1.0, 0.9, 0.8, __
What is one tenth of 50?
A pizza has 8 slices. What is 1/2 of the pizza in slices?
What is the next number when counting in tenths after 0.0?
What is one-third of 9?
How much is one-quarter of 20?
Find one-fifth of the number 25.
What is 1/10 of 100?
What is one half of 18?
A story is 12 pages long. I read 1/3 of it. How many pages did I read?
What number comes before 0.2 when counting in tenths?
Count in tenths from 0.7. What is the next number?
There are 20 questions in a test. 1/10 of them are answered. How many were answered?
Which is larger: 2/5 or 4/5?
There are 12 eggs in a box. 2/3 of them are used. How many eggs are used?
What is 3/4 of 20?
Count up in tenths from 4.8. What is the next number?
Order these fractions from smallest to largest: 1/7, 5/7, 3/7.
A class has 20 children. 3/4 of them are boys. How many boys are there?
Which is smaller: 7/9 or 4/9?
What is 3/5 of 25?
Count backwards in tenths from 3.1. What is the next number?
What is 5/6 of 12?
Which fraction is the greatest: 5/8, 2/8, 8/8?
A bag has 15 sweets. 2/5 of them are green. How many green sweets are there?
Complete the sequence: 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, __
Put these fractions in order, starting with the largest: 6/11, 2/11, 9/11.
What is 3/10 of 50?
Compare 5/12 and 11/12. Which one is bigger?
What is 4/7 of 14?
What number comes before 5.0 when counting down in tenths?
A book has 18 pages. I have read 5/6 of it. How many pages have I read?
Which is smaller: 1 or 9/10?
What is 3/8 of 24?
Complete the sequence: 4.8, 4.9, 5.0, __
There are 24 hours in a day. A cat sleeps for 3/8 of the day. How many hours does it sleep?
Order from smallest to largest: 8/8, 1/8, 4/8.
What is 7/12 of 12?
John ran 0.7 km. Sarah ran 8/10 of a km. Who ran further?
What is 9/10 as a decimal?
A recipe needs 3/5 of a 10kg bag of flour. How many kilograms are needed?
Which is smaller: 0.6 or 7/10?
A plant was 4.2cm tall. It grew by 3/10 of a cm. What is its new height?
Order from smallest to largest: 0.4, 3/10, 0.8.
I have 12 sweets. I give 1/4 to a friend and 1/3 to my brother. Who got more sweets?
What is 4/10 as a decimal?
A test is out of 30. A student scores 2/3 of the marks. What was their score?
Which is greater: 1.0 or 9/10?
Count backwards in tenths from 10.0. What are the next two numbers?
A pizza has 10 slices. If you eat 0.5 of it, how many slices are left?
What is 1/10 as a decimal?
Which is smaller: 1/2 or 4/10?
A car journey is 24 miles. The driver has completed 3/8 of it. How many miles have they driven?
Compare 2/7 and 6/7. Write the larger fraction.
There are 10 apples in a bag. 3/10 are red and 0.5 are green. Are there more red or green apples?
What is 6/10 as a decimal?
A book costs £12. Its price is reduced by 1/4. What is the new price?
Order these: 5/9, 1/9, 9/9.
A tank holds 50 litres. It is 4/5 full. How many litres does it contain?
What is two tenths as a decimal?
A path is 10 metres long. 7/10 of it is paved. What length is paved?
What number is 1/10 less than 1.0?
If you have 5/8 of a pie and give away 2/8, what fraction is left?
I have 24 sweets. I eat 1/4 of them, and then I eat 1/3 of the original amount. How many sweets are left?
A number is 1/5 of 40. What is the number?
Sam says that 2/3 of 12 is 6. Is he correct? Why?
A journey is 5.0 km long. I walk 3/10 of it. How far do I have left to walk, in km?
What is 1/2 of 20 added to 1/4 of 12?
A piece of wood is 8.0 metres long. I cut off 3/8 of it. How long is the remaining piece?
2/5 of a number is 10. What is the original number?
Which is larger: 3/4 of 20, or 2/3 of 24?
A tank contains 10 litres of water. 2/5 of the water is used. Then 1.5 litres are added. How much water is in the tank now?
A runner completes a 10km race. The first 4/10 is uphill. How much of the race, in km, is not uphill?
I have £30. I spend 1/3 of it on a book. How much money do I have left?
A recipe needs 1/2 a cup of flour. I want to make only 1/2 of the recipe. What fraction of a cup of flour do I need?
3/4 of a class of 24 children have brown hair. How many do not have brown hair?
A number is 0.8. What is 1/4 of this number?
Start at 0, count up 7 tenths, then count back 2 tenths. Where are you?
A plant grows 1/10 of a metre each week. How many metres will it have grown after 5 weeks, as a decimal?
3/5 of a number is 15. What is the number?
A box contains red and blue counters. 2/3 of the 18 counters are red. How many are blue?
What is the difference between 1/2 of 10 and 1/5 of 10?
Find the error: 4/5 of 20 is 15.
A jug is 7/8 full. I pour out 3/8 of the full jug. What fraction of the jug is now full?
I am on step 6.8 of a path marked in tenths. How many more tenths do I need to take to get to step 8.0?
There are 100 people at a concert. 1/4 are adults. How many children are there?
What is 1/3 of 9 added to 1/2 of 8?
A number is 0.3. What is this number plus 5/10?
If you divide 25 into 5 equal groups, how many are in each group?
A class has 30 students. 1/3 of them are boys. How many boys are there?
Calculate 2/3 of 9.
There are 12 eggs in a carton. 2/4 of them are used. How many eggs are used?
Find 1/4 of 40.
A book has 20 pages. I have read 3/4 of it. How many pages have I read?
What is 1/10 of 50?
Find two fifths of 10.
A team scored 21 points. 2/3 of the points were scored in the first half. How many points was that?
Find 1/8 of 24.
What is 3/5 of 15?
A baker made 18 cookies. He sold 2/3 of them. How many did he sell?
Find 1/6 of 30.
What is 2/3 of 12?
There are 28 students in a year group. 1/4 are in the school play. How many students are in the play?
Find 2/6 of 12.
What is 1/7 of 21?
Calculate 3/10 of 20.
A pizza is cut into 8 slices. If you eat 1/4 of the pizza, how many slices do you eat?
Find 2/7 of 14.
What is 1/9 of 27?
A bag contains 24 marbles. 3/8 of them are blue. How many are blue?
Calculate four-fifths of 20.
What is 1/12 of 24?
Calculate 5/6 of 18.
What is 3/8 of 40?
A baker makes 36 loaves of bread. He sells 5/6 of them. How many loaves does he sell?
Share 5 pizzas equally among 10 people. What fraction of a pizza does each person get?
Share 3 chocolate bars equally among 6 children. What fraction of a bar does each child get?
Calculate 7/9 of 27.
A piece of ribbon is 48cm long. 3/8 of it is used. How many centimetres are used?
Divide a quantity of 2kg of sugar into 8 equal amounts. What is the fraction of a kg in each amount?
A 4-litre bottle of water is shared between 8 people. What fraction of a litre does each person get?
What is 5/12 of 36?
There are 35 cars in a car park. 4/7 of them are red. How many red cars are there?
If 6 pies are shared equally among 8 friends, what fraction of a pie does each friend receive?
If a 10-metre rope is divided into 12 equal pieces, what is the length of each piece as a fraction?
Calculate 3/11 of 44.
A library has 50 books. 7/10 are fiction. How many fiction books are there?
Share 9 apples among 12 people. What fraction of an apple does each person get?
What is 5/8 of a group of 32 children?
What is 2/9 of 18?
A 1kg bag of flour is used to make 10 cakes. What fraction of a kg does each cake use?
A 2-litre carton of juice fills 5 glasses equally. What fraction of a litre is in each glass?
Find 7/12 of 60.
Calculate 4/5 of 25.
A farmer has 42 animals. 3/7 are sheep. How many sheep are there?
Divide a 1-metre plank into 4 equal pieces. What fraction of a metre is each piece?
Divide 8 kg of sand into 10 bags. What fraction of a kg is in each bag?
What is 9/10 of 100?
A bag contains 24 sweets. I eat 1/4 of them. How many sweets are left?
A book has 50 pages. I read 2/5 of it on Monday. How many pages are left to read?
There are 30 children in a class. 3/10 go to the library. How many children remain in the classroom?
A journey is 40 miles long. I travel 3/8 of the way. How many miles do I still have to travel?
I have £20. I spend 1/4 of my money on a book. How much money do I have left?
A recipe needs 1/2 a litre of milk. I use a 1-litre carton. After making the recipe, what fraction of a litre is left?
A pizza is cut into 8 slices. John eats 1/4 of it. How many slices are left?
A 3-metre rope is cut into 6 equal pieces. What is the length of each piece as a fraction of a metre?
What is 1/2 of 18 added to 1/3 of 18?
A tank holds 36 litres. It is 5/6 full. How many litres are needed to fill it completely?
What is the difference between 3/4 of 16 and 2/3 of 12?
There are 48 cars in a car park. 3/8 are blue. How many are not blue?
I earn £60. I save 1/5 of it. How much do I spend?
A 5-metre plank is cut into 10 pieces. What is the length of each piece as a simplified fraction?
A group of 25 children went on a trip. 2/5 were girls. How many were boys?
A bottle contains 1 litre of juice. 1/4 of it is drunk. How many litres are left?
A farmer has 45 animals. 2/9 are cows. How many animals are not cows?
What is the result of taking 1/4 of 100 away from 1/2 of 100?
I had 30 marbles. I lost 1/3 of them. How many marbles do I have now?
A 6-metre log is cut into 10 pieces. What fraction of a metre is each piece?
From a group of 32 children, 3/8 go swimming. How many children did not go swimming?
A car has a 40-litre fuel tank. After a journey, 1/4 of the fuel is left. How many litres were used?
A bag of 40 apples has 1/10 that are bad. How many good apples are there?
What is 1/2 of 5, as a fraction?
A pie is cut into 8 slices. 3/4 of the pie is eaten. How many slices are left?
3/4 of a number is 15. What is the number?
2/5 of a number is 12. What is the number?
I spent 1/3 of my money, and I have £18 left. How much did I have to start with?
A tank is 3/5 full. It contains 30 litres of water. What is the full capacity of the tank?
I had 30 marbles. I lost 1/3 of them, then gave 1/2 of the rest to a friend. How many do I have now?
A baker makes 40 cakes. He sells 1/4 in the morning and 2/5 of the total in the afternoon. How many are left?
After a 1/4 discount, a toy costs £12. What was the original price?
Which is larger: 2/3 of 18, or the number that 12 is 3/4 of?
There are 60 children in a club. 1/3 are boys. 3/4 of the boys have brown hair. How many boys have brown hair?
I have 50 books. 2/5 are fiction. The rest are non-fiction. How many non-fiction books do I have?
4/7 of a number is 20. What is the number?
A farmer has some sheep. 1/5 of them are black. If there are 8 black sheep, how many sheep are there in total?
A journey is 100 miles. I drive 1/2 of it, then 1/4 of the remaining distance. How far have I travelled?
A class has 32 pupils. 3/8 are boys. How many girls are there?
5/6 of a number is 30. What is 1/2 of that number?
I eat 1/5 of a box of 40 chocolates. My sister eats 1/4 of what is left. How many chocolates remain?
In a survey, 2/3 of people preferred Brand A. If 18 people preferred Brand A, how many people were surveyed in total?
A garden is 2/5 flowers and the rest is lawn. If the lawn is 30 square metres, what is the total area of the garden?
What is the difference between 1/3 of 36 and 1/4 of 40?
A bottle is 1/2 full. I drink 1/3 of the juice in the bottle. What fraction of the original bottle did I drink?
7/10 of a number is 49. What is the number?
A salary is £32,000. 1/4 is paid in tax. How much is left?
I have a collection of 60 stamps. 1/3 are from Europe, 1/4 are from Asia. How many are from other places?
2/7 of the pupils in a school have packed lunches. If 80 pupils have packed lunches, how many pupils are in the school?
What is 3/4 of 200?
A ribbon is 10 metres long. What is half of its length?
A bag of sugar weighs 8kg. What is a quarter of its weight?
What is half of £6.00?
A journey is 4.0 miles. What is a quarter of the distance?
Find 1/2 of 12 cm.
Find 1/4 of 20 litres.
What is the total cost of two drinks that are £1.50 each?
What is half of £9.00?
A plank is 2.5 metres long. A second plank is the same length. What is their total length?
What is 1/4 of a £10 note?
A bottle holds 2 litres of water. If it is half full, how much water is in it?
A book costs £8. What is a quarter of its price?
What is half of a 5kg bag of potatoes?
A fence is 16 metres long. A quarter of it is painted. How many metres are painted?
What is half of £1.00?
A journey takes 2 hours. What is a quarter of that time in hours?
I have £3.00. I spend half of it. How much did I spend?
A cake weighs 1kg. If I eat a quarter of it, how many kg have I eaten?
What is 1/2 of 3 metres?
What is 1/4 of 1kg?
A chocolate bar costs £0.50. How much do two bars cost?
What is half of a 30cm ruler?
What is a quarter of 1 hour, in hours?
Find 1/2 of £7.00.
A box contains 12 cans. A quarter of them are removed. How many cans were removed?
What is 3/4 of a 1-litre bottle of juice, in litres?
A pen costs £0.75. A book costs £2.50. What is their total cost?
I have £10.00 and I spend £4.25. How much change do I get?
A piece of string is 1 metre long. I cut off 3/10 of it. How many metres did I cut off?
A bag of apples weighs 1.2kg. I use 1/10 of the bag. How much do I use in kg?
What is 7/10 of a metre in metres?
A drink costs £1.25. How much change would you get from a £5 note?
Find the total cost of two items priced at £1.50 and £2.25.
A journey is 20 miles. I travel 3/4 of the way. How many miles have I travelled?
What is 1/10 of £5.00?
A ribbon is 2 metres long. If I use 3/4 of it, how much have I used in metres?
What is the sum of £0.85 and £1.15?
If you have £2.00 and spend 75p, how much do you have left?
A bottle contains 1 litre of juice. 1/10 is poured out. How many litres are left?
What is 3/10 of 2 kg?
A piece of wood is 0.8m long. What is 1/4 of its length?
What is the change from £2.00 for an item costing £1.45?
A bag contains 1kg of sugar. If 1/10 is used, how many kg are left?
What is 1/2 of £3.50?
A journey takes 0.75 hours. What is this as a fraction of an hour?
A book costs £6.25 and a pen costs £1.50. What is the total?
I have £1.00 and buy a sweet for 35p. How much do I have left?
A can holds 0.33 litres. If I drink 1/3 of it, how many litres do I drink?
What is 9/10 of 1 metre?
A film is 1.5 hours long. If I watch 1/2 of it, how long have I watched for?
I have a 1m ribbon. I cut off 1/4 of it, then another 0.2m. How much ribbon is left in metres?
A bag of flour weighs 2kg. I use 3/10 of it. How many grams are left?
A drink costs £1.25. I buy two. How much change do I get from £5.00?
A plank of wood is 2.5 metres long. I cut off a piece that is 75cm long. How long is the remaining piece in metres?
I have £5.50. I spend half of it. How much do I have left?
What is 3/5 of 2kg, in grams?
A journey is 10km. I walk 1/4 of it and run 0.6 of it. What distance is left to travel?
A bottle holds 1.5 litres. I pour out 3/10 of a litre. How much is left?
Find the total cost of 3 items at £0.80 each and one item at £1.50.
A 2kg bag of sugar costs £1.80. What is the cost of 1/2 of the bag?
A rectangle has a length of 0.8m and a width of 50cm. What is its perimeter in metres?
What is 1/4 of £10 plus 1/2 of £5?
A film is 2.5 hours long. If 4/5 of it has passed, how many hours are left?
A piece of cheese weighs 0.6kg. I eat 1/3 of it. What is the weight of the remaining cheese?
I have a 5-metre roll of tape. I use 80cm. How much is left in metres?
What is 3/8 of 4 metres, in metres?
From a 1 litre bottle, I pour 0.25L and then 1/5 of a litre. How much is left?
A cafe sells cups of tea for £1.20. How much do 5 cups of tea cost?
A container holds 2kg of rice. 3/4 of the rice is used. How many grams of rice are left?
What is the total of 1.25kg and 3/4 kg?
I run 0.6km every day. How far do I run in 5 days?
A watermelon weighs 3kg. I eat 1/5 of it. How much is left in kg?
What is the cost of 4 pens at £0.65 each?
A bag of sugar is 1.5kg. If 1/3 is used, how many kg are left?
A fence is made of 10 panels, each 0.8m wide. What is the total length of the fence?
I have £10. I buy a book for £4.50 and a magazine that costs 1/2 of the book's price. How much money do I have left?
After spending 3/4 of my money, I have £5 left. How much money did I have initially?
Which is better value: a 0.5 litre bottle of juice for £1.20, or a 1/4 litre bottle for 70p?
A car uses 1/4 of a full tank of petrol. If a full tank is 40 litres, how many litres were used?
A runner wants to complete 10km. She runs 0.6 of the distance, then walks 1/4 of the remaining distance. How far has she left to go?
I have 1.5kg of flour. A recipe needs 1/2 kg of flour. How many times can I make the recipe?
A shop reduces a £20 jumper by 1/10. What is the new price?
Which is larger: 3/5 of 2 metres, or 1.1 metres?
A garden has an area of 40 square metres. 3/8 of it is patio, and the rest is grass. What is the area of the grass?
